meanings.definition: A prolonged high-pitched cry expressing pain or grief.
meanings.sent1: The baby's wail could be heard throughout the house.
meanings.sent2: The mournful wail of the widow echoed in the empty room.
meanings.sent3: The wail of the wind outside made the house feel haunted.
meanings.sent4: Her wail of despair pierced through the silence of the night.
meanings.sent5: The wail of the ambulance siren signaled an emergency nearby.

meanings.definition: To make a prolonged high-pitched cry expressing pain or grief.
meanings.sent1: She would wail loudly whenever she was upset.
meanings.sent2: The child began to wail when he lost his favorite toy.
meanings.sent3: The cat would wail at the closed door until someone opened it.
meanings.sent4: The sirens wailed in the distance, signaling the approach of the storm.
meanings.sent5: The wind wailed through the trees, creating an eerie atmosphere.
